00045 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 #define EEPROM_PAGE_WRITE_SIZE  16
00047 
00048 /* Private variables ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00049 sI2CM_Transfer I2CM_Transfer;

00062 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00063  * @brief   This function handles Hard Fault exception.
00064  * @retval  None
00065  ************************************************************************************************************/
00066 void HardFault_Handler(void)
00067 {
00068   #if 1
00069 
00070   static vu32 gIsContinue = 0;
00071   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00072   /* For development FW, MCU run into the while loop when the hardfault occurred.                           */
00073   /* 1. Stack Checking                                                                                      */
00074   /*    When a hard fault exception occurs, MCU push following register into the stack (main or process     */
00075   /*    stack). Confirm R13(SP) value in the Register Window and typing it to the Memory Windows, you can   */
00076   /*    check following register, especially the PC value (indicate the last instruction before hard fault).*/
00077   /*    SP + 0x00    0x04    0x08    0x0C    0x10    0x14    0x18    0x1C                                   */
00078   /*           R0      R1      R2      R3     R12      LR      PC    xPSR                                   */
00079   while (gIsContinue == 0)
00080   {
00081   }
00082   /* 2. Step Out to Find the Clue                                                                           */
00083   /*    Change the variable "gIsContinue" to any other value than zero in a Local or Watch Window, then     */
00084   /*    step out the HardFault_Handler to reach the first instruction after the instruction which caused    */
00085   /*    the hard fault.                                                                                     */
00086   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00087 
00088   #else
00089 
00090   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00091   /* For production FW, you shall consider to reboot the system when hardfault occurred.                    */
00092   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00093   NVIC_SystemReset();
00094 
00095   #endif
00096 }

00157 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00158  * @brief   This function handles I2C0 interrupt. (I2C Master to access EEPROM)
00159  * @retval  None
00160  ************************************************************************************************************/
00161 void I2C0_IRQHandler(void)
00162 {
00163   vu32 state;
00164   u32 i;
00165   state = HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT->SR;
00166   HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT->SR = state;
00167 
00168   /* Check BUS error condition                                                                              */
00169   if (state & I2C_FLAG_BUSERR)
00170   {
00171     I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_BUSERR;
00172     goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00173   }
00174 
00175   /* Check timeout condition                                                                                */
00176   if (state & I2C_FLAG_TOUTF)
00177   {
00178     I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_TOUTF;
00179     goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00180   }
00181 
00182   /* Check Arbitration Loss condition                                                                       */
00183   if (state & I2C_FLAG_ARBLOS)
00184   {
00185     I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_ARBLOS;
00186     goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00187   }
00188 
00189   /* Check NACK condition                                                                                   */
00190   if (state & I2C_FLAG_RXNACK)
00191   {
00192     if (I2CM_Transfer.RetryDownCounter)
00193     {
00194       I2CM_Transfer.RetryDownCounter--;
00195       I2C_TargetAddressConfig(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT, I2CM_Transfer.DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_WRITE);
00196       return;
00197     }
00198     else
00199     {
00200       I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_SLAVE_NO_RESPONSE;
00201       goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00202     }
00203   }
00204 
00205   if (I2CM_Transfer.Buffer)
00206   {
00207     switch (state)
00208     {
00209       /*-----------------------------Master Transmitter ----------------------------------------------------*/
00210       case I2C_MASTER_SEND_START:
00211         break;
00212 
00213       case I2C_MASTER_TRANSMITTER_MODE:
00214         /* Send the register address to I2C                                                                 */
00215         HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT->DR = I2CM_Transfer.RegAddr;
00216         break;
00217 
00218       case I2C_MASTER_TX_EMPTY:
00219         if (I2CM_Transfer.Direction == I2CM_DIRECTION_OUT)
00220         {
00221           if (I2CM_Transfer.Counter < I2CM_Transfer.Length)
00222           {
00223             HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT->DR = I2CM_Transfer.Buffer[I2CM_Transfer.Counter++];
00224           }
00225           else
00226           {
00227             /* Send I2C STOP condition                                                                      */
00228             I2C_GenerateSTOP(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT);
00229             I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_OK;
00230             I2CM_Transfer.Locked = FALSE;
00231           }
00232         }
00233         else
00234         {
00235           /* Send Repeated Start to change the I2C transfer direction                                       */
00236           I2C_TargetAddressConfig(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT, I2CM_Transfer.DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_READ);
00237         }
00238         break;
00239 
00240       /*-----------------------------Master Receiver -------------------------------------------------------*/
00241       case I2C_MASTER_RECEIVER_MODE:
00242         /* Enable I2CM ACK for receiving data                                                               */
00243         if (I2CM_Transfer.Length > 1)
00244         {
00245           I2C_AckCmd(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT, ENABLE);
00246         }
00247         break;
00248 
00249       case I2C_MASTER_RX_NOT_EMPTY:
00250         /* Receive data sent from I2C                                                                       */
00251         i = I2CM_Transfer.Counter; 
00252         I2CM_Transfer.Buffer[i] = HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT->DR;
00253         I2CM_Transfer.Counter++;
00254         if (I2CM_Transfer.Counter == I2CM_Transfer.Length - 1)
00255         {
00256           /* Disable I2CM ACK                                                                               */
00257           I2C_AckCmd(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT, DISABLE);
00258         }
00259         if (I2CM_Transfer.Counter == I2CM_Transfer.Length)
00260         {
00261           /* Generate STOP                                                                                  */
00262           I2C_GenerateSTOP(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT);
00263           I2CM_Transfer.Locked = FALSE;
00264           I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_OK;
00265         }
00266         break;
00267 
00268       default:
00269         //printf("Undefine State %08X\r\n", state);
00270         break;
00271     }
00272     return;
00273   }
00274   else
00275   {
00276     I2CM_Transfer.Status = I2CM_BUFFER_NULL;
00277   }
00278 
00279 i2c_master_transfer_error:
00280   /* Send I2C STOP condition                                                                                */
00281   I2C_GenerateSTOP(HTCFG_I2C_MASTER_PORT);
00282   I2CM_Transfer.Locked = FALSE;
00283   return;
00284 }
00285 
00286 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00287  * @brief   This function handles I2C1 interrupt. (Simulate EEPROM slave)
00288  * @retval  None
00289  ************************************************************************************************************/
00290 void I2C1_IRQHandler(void)
00291 {
00292   static u8 MemAddr = 0;
00293   static s32 WriteIndex;
00294   u32 ProgramIndex, BaseAddr;
00295 
00296   switch (I2C_ReadRegister(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT, I2C_REGISTER_SR))
00297   {
00298     /*-----------------------------Slave Receiver ----------------------------------------------------------*/
00299     case I2C_SLAVE_ACK_RECEIVER_ADDRESS:
00300       WriteIndex = -1;
00301       break;
00302 
00303     case I2C_SLAVE_RX_NOT_EMPTY:
00304       if (WriteIndex == -1)
00305       {
00306         MemAddr = I2C_ReceiveData(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT);
00307         WriteIndex = MemAddr;
00308       }
00309       else
00310       {
00311         EEPROM_PageWriteBuffer[WriteIndex % EEPROM_PAGE_WRITE_SIZE] = I2C_ReceiveData(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT);
00312         WriteIndex++;
00313       }
00314       break;
00315 
00316     case I2C_SLAVE_STOP_DETECTED:
00317       /* Start program EEPROM                                                                               */
00318       I2C_AckCmd(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT, DISABLE);
00319       BaseAddr = MemAddr - (MemAddr % EEPROM_PAGE_WRITE_SIZE);
00320 
00321       for (ProgramIndex = MemAddr; ProgramIndex < WriteIndex; ProgramIndex++)
00322       {
00323         vu32 j = 3000;
00324         u8 PageBufferPointer;
00325         while (j--);
00326 
00327         PageBufferPointer = ProgramIndex % EEPROM_PAGE_WRITE_SIZE;
00328         EEPROM_Memory[BaseAddr + PageBufferPointer] = EEPROM_PageWriteBuffer[PageBufferPointer];
00329       }
00330 
00331       I2C_AckCmd(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT, ENABLE);
00332       break;
00333 
00334     /*-----------------------------Slave Transmitter -------------------------------------------------------*/
00335     case I2C_SLAVE_ACK_TRANSMITTER_ADDRESS:
00336     case I2C_SLAVE_TX_EMPTY:
00337       /* Send data to master                                                                                */
00338       I2C_SendData(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT, EEPROM_Memory[MemAddr++]);
00339       break;
00340 
00341     case I2C_SLAVE_RECEIVED_NACK_STOP:
00342       /* Clear RXNACK flag                                                                                  */
00343       I2C_ClearFlag(HTCFG_I2C_EEPROM_PORT, I2C_FLAG_RXNACK);
00344       break;
00345 
00346     default:
00347       break;
00348   }
00349 }
